<div id="review_1969150560" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1969150560" />
    <a title="Monika" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3970914-monika"><img alt="Monika" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1483079507p2/3970914.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1969150560?book_show_action=true">Aug 25, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Monika" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Monika" href="/user/show/3970914-monika">Monika</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3970914-monika?shelf=ownvoices">ownvoices</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1969150560" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer7094047791236192000">This is one of those I-loved-it-so-much-where-do-I-even-start!?! kind of reviews.<br /><br />First off, it took me almost 4 months to read this anthology of short stories because I did not want the book to end. I savored each and every story. I love speculation fiction, I'm super picky about sci-fi, and I don't have much success with fantasy. But I cannot think of a single story in this book that didn't delight. All of them were fantastic and fierce.<br /><br />Calvin Gimpelevich's "Rent, Don't Sell" (about body switch</span>
  <span id="freeText7094047791236192000" style="display:none">This is one of those I-loved-it-so-much-where-do-I-even-start!?! kind of reviews.<br /><br />First off, it took me almost 4 months to read this anthology of short stories because I did not want the book to end. I savored each and every story. I love speculation fiction, I'm super picky about sci-fi, and I don't have much success with fantasy. But I cannot think of a single story in this book that didn't delight. All of them were fantastic and fierce.<br /><br />Calvin Gimpelevich's "Rent, Don't Sell" (about body switching and its impact on one's identity) was a speculative fiction lover's dream. "Imago" by Tristan Alice Nieto is about coming back from the dead (for a little while, and as an undead) and the parallels to transitioning were surprisingly poignant:<br /><br /><i>"I get a message from a friend. They're sorry that they haven't called yet, but they're still in shock. They don't know if they're going to be able to see me like this. They're really, really sorry.<br /> Everyone's so fucking sorry."</i><br /><br />"Delicate Bodies" by Bridget Liang was one of my favorites. Think zombie apocalypse with a twist. The protagonist, Beryl, is Chinese-Canadian, from a Buddhist family, a trans woman, vegetarian, and... a zombie. It's dark and twisted and horrifyingly WTF but holy moly, somehow SO funny! Lots of social commentary packed into this one. This story is decidedly feminist, intersectional, and downright brilliant.<br /><br />These stories are incredibly diverse in perspective, imagination, and style. Best of all, I ended up with a slew of new-to-me writers to keep an eye on! Don't miss out on this one.</span>
  <a data-text-id="7094047791236192000" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1965727958" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1965727958" />
    <a title="Danika at The Lesbrary" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3796959-danika-at-the-lesbrary"><img alt="Danika at The Lesbrary" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1400393463p2/3796959.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1965727958?book_show_action=true">Oct 28, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Danika at The Lesbrary" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Danika at The Lesbrary" href="/user/show/3796959-danika-at-the-lesbrary">Danika at The Lesbrary</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1965727958" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer10945894913964428121">As always in an anthology, some of these were bigger hits than others, but overall I really enjoyed these. Tons of sapphic stories, too! Some of the first stories were so fascinating, I could easily write essays about them. <br /><br />The stories vary a lot. There are more sci fi stories than fantasy, and more trans women than nonbinary or trans men main characters. The plots vary from someone quietly ruminating in space about microaggressions to intense cyberpunk... cyber post-punk? In fact, quite a few o</span>
  <span id="freeText10945894913964428121" style="display:none">As always in an anthology, some of these were bigger hits than others, but overall I really enjoyed these. Tons of sapphic stories, too! Some of the first stories were so fascinating, I could easily write essays about them. <br /><br />The stories vary a lot. There are more sci fi stories than fantasy, and more trans women than nonbinary or trans men main characters. The plots vary from someone quietly ruminating in space about microaggressions to intense cyberpunk... cyber post-punk? In fact, quite a few of the stories have a punk undertone.<br /><br />Definite trigger warnings for transphobia, transmisogyny, violence, gore, and rape. In fact, the one story I had a problem with is Delicate Bodies, in which the main character is a zombie who rapes and then kills her ex-boyfriends/crushes. I get the zombie revenge fantasy, but I was honestly getting nauseated reading about her brutally raping multiple people, and the text seems to suggest that they deserve it. They may have been jerks, but they didn't do anything comparable. That soured the collection for me.</span>
  <a data-text-id="10945894913964428121" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_2114983763" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2114983763" />
    <a title="Lorax" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/71126048-lorax"><img alt="Lorax" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_50x66-632230dc9882b4352d753eedf9396530.png" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2114983763?book_show_action=true">Sep 05, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Lorax" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Lorax" href="/user/show/71126048-lorax">Lorax</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2114983763" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer8220146727018050993">I lived with this book, carried it with me like a precious tome, whipping it out to evangelically read passages to various companions who shared my time while I dove in the worlds of these exciting new writers. <br /><br />Not every story was a page-turner, but in every story, the words laid out beckoned to me in strange new ways. <br /><br />Perhaps the most shocking chapter was science fiction only in its premise: one author has imagined a future where being trans is treated as routine by the surrounding characters i</span>
  <span id="freeText8220146727018050993" style="display:none">I lived with this book, carried it with me like a precious tome, whipping it out to evangelically read passages to various companions who shared my time while I dove in the worlds of these exciting new writers. <br /><br />Not every story was a page-turner, but in every story, the words laid out beckoned to me in strange new ways. <br /><br />Perhaps the most shocking chapter was science fiction only in its premise: one author has imagined a future where being trans is treated as routine by the surrounding characters in an anonymous North American high school. This trans girl living the first day of the rest of her life, was the character that stayed with me the longest. It was her story that has haunted me with its questions. She exists in a parallel reality even time-travel wouldn't deliver me to, if I were to be sent back to my teenage self and, instead of a forced puberty, given my choice of hormones. <br /><br />Time itself, I am told, exists differently for trans people. It is fitting, then, to seek out speculative fiction written by these timeless beings. We think of the problems of human existence quite differently from someone who has never had to question the identity markers under their skin. I hope this collection of fresh trans science fiction and fantasy becomes a yearly edition, because this book needs to sit on a shelf with many more experiments in trans creative writing. The worlds trans people imagine are beautiful, like our bodies are beautiful, and I can't wait for there to be more. </span>
  <a data-text-id="8220146727018050993" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">


<tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review2114983763">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_2114983763'><a id="like_count_review_2114983763" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/2114983763?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">1 like</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F34750876-meanwhile-elsewhere">Like</a></span>
&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a href="/review/show/2114983763?book_show_action=true&amp;from_review_page=1">see review</a>

    <div class="section">


<div id="review_2426877840" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2426877840" />
    <a title="Kat Rogue" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/82875953-kat-rogue"><img alt="Kat Rogue" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1528514530p2/82875953.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2426877840?book_show_action=true">Jun 17, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Kat Rogue" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Kat Rogue" href="/user/show/82875953-kat-rogue">Kat Rogue</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2426877840" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer7218172364846990753">This collection is phenomenal. Most of the stories hit the perfect tone right off the bat, and some have snuck back into my psyche months after I dismissed them too quickly. Quite a few have completely redesigned the way I read science fiction as a whole. It's that good. It's SO haunting. The authors bring varied scifi takes through common trans tropes, so it's familiar for trans readers, yet elevated in unexpected ways. This is the first time these takes have been compiled together, and I hope</span>
  <span id="freeText7218172364846990753" style="display:none">This collection is phenomenal. Most of the stories hit the perfect tone right off the bat, and some have snuck back into my psyche months after I dismissed them too quickly. Quite a few have completely redesigned the way I read science fiction as a whole. It's that good. It's SO haunting. The authors bring varied scifi takes through common trans tropes, so it's familiar for trans readers, yet elevated in unexpected ways. This is the first time these takes have been compiled together, and I hope it's the first volume of many to come. <br /><br />There were a few stories that I didn't finish reading, and the work as a whole didn't quite meet the promises made on the back pages. The concepts of futuristic relationship styles or ways of being trans outside of capitalism weren't quite explored. A couple stories even felt like abridged versions of full novels that needed more time and space to explore. <br /><br />That's a good thing! It means I want MORE TRANS SCI FI AUTHORS. It's so thrilling to see so many trans authors of varying fame and skill share these pages! <br /><br />This is mandatory reading.</span>
  <a data-text-id="7218172364846990753" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">


<tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review2426877840">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_2426877840'><a id="like_count_review_2426877840" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/2426877840?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">1 like</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F34750876-meanwhile-elsewhere">Like</a></span>

<div id="review_2405005793" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2405005793" />
    <a title="Brook" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1222812-brook"><img alt="Brook" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1497636309p2/1222812.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2405005793?book_show_action=true">May 27, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Brook" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Brook" href="/user/show/1222812-brook">Brook</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2405005793" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer3554666689597544145">There’s no trans monolith in these pages, or anywhere on this planet. Not all of the characters in this book are heroes, and not all of them are feel good stories, which makes this collection the most human trans book I’ve read in some time. Ultimately, this collection of 25 stories leaves me hungry for more from each of these authors. There’s a whole universe of genre fiction to populate, so they’d better get on it. If you need a book to get you through a fall and winter of dreams, fireplaces,</span>
  <span id="freeText3554666689597544145" style="display:none">There’s no trans monolith in these pages, or anywhere on this planet. Not all of the characters in this book are heroes, and not all of them are feel good stories, which makes this collection the most human trans book I’ve read in some time. Ultimately, this collection of 25 stories leaves me hungry for more from each of these authors. There’s a whole universe of genre fiction to populate, so they’d better get on it. If you need a book to get you through a fall and winter of dreams, fireplaces, and early sunset, this is it. And, if you want a book of possibilities, one where we as trans folks can be anything, monster or hero, this is it.<br /><br />(more at <a target="_blank" href="https://medium.com/@brookshelley/a-review-of-meanwhile-elsewhere-166ec11bff7d" rel="nofollow">https://medium.com/@brookshelley/a-re...</a>)</span>
  <a data-text-id="3554666689597544145" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

    <div class="section">


<div id="review_2169763760" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2169763760" />
    <a title="Alanna Why" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21811444-alanna-why"><img alt="Alanna Why" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1525962830p2/21811444.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2169763760?book_show_action=true">Apr 16, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Alanna Why" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Alanna Why" href="/user/show/21811444-alanna-why">Alanna Why</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2169763760" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer4288293447759693010"><i>Meanwhile, Elsewhere</i> is a fresh collection of sci-fi, fantasy and horror short stories from contemporary trans writers. Even though I am not a huge fan of these genres, I loved how the writers in this collection played with and subverted conventions of the genre's stereotypical plots, characters and themes. Like any anthology, it is a mixed bag, but the overall quality of this collection is very high. There were only a handful of stories that I couldn't get into and even the stories I didn't enj</span>
  <span id="freeText4288293447759693010" style="display:none"><i>Meanwhile, Elsewhere</i> is a fresh collection of sci-fi, fantasy and horror short stories from contemporary trans writers. Even though I am not a huge fan of these genres, I loved how the writers in this collection played with and subverted conventions of the genre's stereotypical plots, characters and themes. Like any anthology, it is a mixed bag, but the overall quality of this collection is very high. There were only a handful of stories that I couldn't get into and even the stories I didn't enjoy as much still took exciting literary risks. My favourite stories were "Delicate Bodies" by Bridget Liang, "What Cheer" by RJ Edwards, "After The Big One" by Cooper Lee Bombardier, "Cybervania" by Sybil Lamb and "Thieves and Lovers" by Emma Addams. Still, my #1 story from the collection was "Imago" by Tristan Alice Nieto (who knew that a story told from the perspective of a resuscitated corpse could be so beautiful and moving and human that it would make me cry?) Great collection overall, for both fans of the genre and not! </span>
  <a data-text-id="4288293447759693010" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_2169763760'><a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F34750876-meanwhile-elsewhere">Like</a></span>

<div id="review_2458438665" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2458438665" />
    <a title="King Ma" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/56826633-king-ma"><img alt="King Ma" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466002507p2/56826633.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2458438665?book_show_action=true">Jul 15, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="King Ma" class="user" itemprop="url" name="King Ma" href="/user/show/56826633-king-ma">King Ma</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2458438665" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer17875545006580537039">Bioware harvesting, body snatching, alien doppelgängers, zombified gender affirming surgeries, the immaculate conception via uterine transplant. A bookseller at the Philadelphia Trans Health conference sold me this collection of stories and I highly recommend it. The blurb on the back of the book says the book changed the way I dreamed. Same. Every story is memorable and there isn’t one I didn’t like. </span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

It has honestly "changed the way I dream" (as the back cover says) and I am a different person now. As it is a collection of stories, there were some I LOVED and some I couldn't finish, but overall it is a beautiful book of stories by, for, and about trans people. </span>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_2185822625" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2185822625" />
    <a title="Jenna" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9007836-jenna"><img alt="Jenna" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1495681807p2/9007836.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2185822625?book_show_action=true">Jun 22, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Jenna" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Jenna" href="/user/show/9007836-jenna">Jenna</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9007836-jenna?shelf=adult">adult</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9007836-jenna?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9007836-jenna?shelf=lgbtqia">lgbtqia</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9007836-jenna?shelf=science-fiction">science-fiction</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2185822625" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer16807294707718197934">Overall I found the stories innovative and quite different, but I hadn’t anticipated the level of gore and violence in this anthology. Might just be a different retelling or viewing of the genres, as they felt more dystopian / cyberpunk / horror for the most part. Some of the short stories were also harder to get into than others, but then some blew me away. It’s probably just me! </span>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_2392834745" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2392834745" />
    <a title="Brittni Brinn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/46031745-brittni-brinn"><img alt="Brittni Brinn" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1518468203p2/46031745.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2392834745?book_show_action=true">May 15, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Brittni Brinn" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Brittni Brinn" href="/user/show/46031745-brittni-brinn">Brittni Brinn</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2392834745" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer16446418339866969340">Fantastic collection of many imagination-creations: some thoughtful, some surreal, some visceral. This is what science fiction should be, pushing the boundaries of genre and creating new spaces for what-if futures and social commentary. Truly is the "#1 post-reality generation device approved for home use!" (love the cover design as well!)</span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">


<tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review2392834745">

<div id="review_2119024772" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2119024772" />
    <a title="M." class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/408843-m"><img alt="M." src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1390876833p2/408843.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2119024772?book_show_action=true">Sep 28, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="M." class="user" itemprop="url" name="M." href="/user/show/408843-m">M.</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/408843-m?shelf=disability">disability</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/408843-m?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/408843-m?shelf=gender">gender</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/408843-m?shelf=queer">queer</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/408843-m?shelf=scifi">scifi</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/408843-m?shelf=trans">trans</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2119024772" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer11518426814853114825">I reviewed this anthology of SFF by trans writers for Strange Horizons: <br /><br />Excerpt: "If its heft at nearly 450 pages is any indication, it’s not the first trans SF/F anthology due to any dearth of writing. A big book, it has the feel of arrival, this mysterious rectangular object finally crashing down from the future, or many futures. Addressing issues as various as reproductive technology, haunted adolescence, trans monstrosity, trans-trans love (and sex), and good old-fashioned coming out woes, t</span>
  <span id="freeText11518426814853114825" style="display:none">I reviewed this anthology of SFF by trans writers for Strange Horizons: <br /><br />Excerpt: "If its heft at nearly 450 pages is any indication, it’s not the first trans SF/F anthology due to any dearth of writing. A big book, it has the feel of arrival, this mysterious rectangular object finally crashing down from the future, or many futures. Addressing issues as various as reproductive technology, haunted adolescence, trans monstrosity, trans-trans love (and sex), and good old-fashioned coming out woes, these stories represent a spectrum of trans experience and a range of speculative genres. All are explicitly trans-centered, and all speak to a trans—or trans-literate—readership. There’s very little explaining, in other words, which leaves more room for the alien spore that’s just landed, and the hologram café. "<br /><br />More here: <a target="_blank" href="http://strangehorizons.com/non-fiction/reviews/meanwhile-elsewhere-science-fiction-and-fantasy-from-transgender-writers-edited-by-cat-fitzpatrick-and-casey-plett/" rel="nofollow">http://strangehorizons.com/non-fictio...</a><br /></span>
  <a data-text-id="11518426814853114825" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="bookMeta"
     class="uitext stacked hreview-aggregate"
     style="position: relative"
     itemprop="aggregateRating"

     itemtype="https://schema.org/AggregateRating">

      $('rating_details').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });
      $('rating_details').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

<div id="descriptionContainer">

      <div id="description" class="readable stacked" style="right:0">

<span id="freeTextContainer8997812881665960575">Ancient folklore and modern myth come together in these stories by author Craig Laurance Gidney. Here are found the struggles of a medieval Japanese monk, seduced by a mischievous fairy, and a young slave who finds mystery deep within the briar patch of an antebellum plantation. Gidney offers readers a gay teen obsessed with his patron saint, Lena Horne, and, in the title</span>
  <span id="freeText8997812881665960575" style="display:none">Ancient folklore and modern myth come together in these stories by author Craig Laurance Gidney. Here are found the struggles of a medieval Japanese monk, seduced by a mischievous fairy, and a young slave who finds mystery deep within the briar patch of an antebellum plantation. Gidney offers readers a gay teen obsessed with his patron saint, Lena Horne, and, in the title story, an ailing tourist seeking escape at a distant shore but never reckons on encountering an African sea god. Rich, poetic, dark and disturbing, these are tales not soon forgotten. A finalist for the Lambda Literary Award.</span>
  <a data-text-id="8997812881665960575" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

      </div>
</div>

          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });
      $('rating_details_tip').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

//]]>
</script>  </div>

    <div class="section firstReview">


<div id="review_1320384300" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1320384300" />
    <a title="K.J. Charles" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21413858-k-j-charles"><img alt="K.J. Charles" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1427103031p2/21413858.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1320384300?book_show_action=true">Jun 28, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="K.J. Charles" class="user" itemprop="url" name="K.J. Charles" href="/user/show/21413858-k-j-charles">K.J. Charles</a>
      </span>

          added it







          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21413858-k-j-charles?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21413858-k-j-charles?shelf=gay">gay</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1320384300" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer5648627333199369988">Woah. I don't often read short stories, but this collection was amazing. No wonder Gidney is winning awards. Fantasy stories, mostly contemporary, protags mostly gay and black, but veering off to Rimbaud and Japanese monasteries and suchlike, just because the author can. Stunning writing, stunning imagination, very unsettling. I just bought <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/24811051.Skin_Deep_Magic_Short_Fiction" title="Skin Deep Magic Short Fiction by Craig Laurance Gidney" rel="nofollow">Skin Deep Magic: Short Fiction</a> on the back of this, and am pretty much going to work through everything I can get my hands on. A really excellent writer. </span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_791058815" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/791058815" />
    <a title="Nikki " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/223837-nikki"><img alt="Nikki " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1308224598p2/223837.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/791058815?book_show_action=true">Dec 15, 2013</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Nikki " class="user" itemprop="url" name="Nikki " href="/user/show/223837-nikki">Nikki </a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/223837-nikki?shelf=shelflove-2017">shelflove-2017</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/223837-nikki?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/223837-nikki?shelf=short-stories-novellas">short-stories-novellas</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/223837-nikki?shelf=horror">horror</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer791058815" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer15105899107621445881">I’m not honestly sure what I thought of this collection. The writing is really strong, and I found that I had to keep turning the pages to get more of it — but some of the stories just grossed me out so much and made me feel really uncomfortable. They’re undoubtedly powerful, but not really a style that I enjoy. There’s a bit in the Goodreads description that about sums this set of stories up: “rich, poetic, dark and disturbing”. Yep.<br /><br />One of the most powerful of the bunch is definitely the most d</span>
  <span id="freeText15105899107621445881" style="display:none">I’m not honestly sure what I thought of this collection. The writing is really strong, and I found that I had to keep turning the pages to get more of it — but some of the stories just grossed me out so much and made me feel really uncomfortable. They’re undoubtedly powerful, but not really a style that I enjoy. There’s a bit in the Goodreads description that about sums this set of stories up: “rich, poetic, dark and disturbing”. Yep.<br /><br />One of the most powerful of the bunch is definitely the most disturbing to me; if you want warnings about what ‘Etiolate’ contains, I can let you know.<br /><br /><a href="https://breathesbooks.com/2017/11/15/review-sea-swallow-me/" rel="nofollow">Reviewed on The Bibliophibian.</a></span>
  <a data-text-id="15105899107621445881" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >
    <div class="section">


<div id="review_2427395044" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2427395044" />
    <a title="Stephen Poltz" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/37049500-stephen-poltz"><img alt="Stephen Poltz" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1436046258p2/37049500.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2427395044?book_show_action=true">Jun 24, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Stephen Poltz" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Stephen Poltz" href="/user/show/37049500-stephen-poltz">Stephen Poltz</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/8705948-sea-swallow-me-and-other-stories">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37049500-stephen-poltz?shelf=sf-fantasy-horror">sf-fantasy-horror</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2427395044" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer5728386918055435990">This is a collection of short stories which was nominated for the Lambda Literary Award for SF/Fantasy/Horror. Most of the stories would fall into the Fantasy category, and perhaps under the subheading of Urban Fantasy. Almost all have to do with some sort of spiritual or mystical experience. The prose is absolutely beautiful and the characters developed nicely for short stories. The protagonists are mostly gay and/or black, with a few exceptions being a young Buddhist monk in a monastery, and a</span>
  <span id="freeText5728386918055435990" style="display:none">This is a collection of short stories which was nominated for the Lambda Literary Award for SF/Fantasy/Horror. Most of the stories would fall into the Fantasy category, and perhaps under the subheading of Urban Fantasy. Almost all have to do with some sort of spiritual or mystical experience. The prose is absolutely beautiful and the characters developed nicely for short stories. The protagonists are mostly gay and/or black, with a few exceptions being a young Buddhist monk in a monastery, and a white Frenchman. It’s a wonderful collection that I was glad to finally get around to. <br /><br />Come visit my blog for the full review…<br /><a target="_blank" href="https://itstartedwiththehugos.blogspot.com/2018/06/sea-swallow-me.html" rel="nofollow">https://itstartedwiththehugos.blogspo...</a></span>
  <a data-text-id="5728386918055435990" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_2427395044'><a id="like_count_review_2427395044" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/2427395044?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">1 like</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3834230-sea-swallow-me-and-other-stories">Like</a></span>

  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >
    <div class="section">


<div id="review_56152474" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/56152474" />
    <a title="Elisa Rolle" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2156728-elisa-rolle"><img alt="Elisa Rolle" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442983896p2/2156728.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/56152474?book_show_action=true">May 15, 2009</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Elisa Rolle" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Elisa Rolle" href="/user/show/2156728-elisa-rolle">Elisa Rolle</a>
      </span>

          added it







    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer56152474" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer14930025428049609305">This is really a strange anthology and not a romance at all; some of the characters are gay men, both modern or myth or figures from the past, but it's not them being gay that linked all the story, it's more the unexpected and the legend, the faith and the myth mixed together.<br /><br />The Safety of Thorns: Israel is a slave boy who lives in a plantation; he is very young (don't know exactly the age but he is still working little jobs around, so I believe he is nothing more than a child). One day, near th</span>
  <span id="freeText14930025428049609305" style="display:none">This is really a strange anthology and not a romance at all; some of the characters are gay men, both modern or myth or figures from the past, but it's not them being gay that linked all the story, it's more the unexpected and the legend, the faith and the myth mixed together.<br /><br />The Safety of Thorns: Israel is a slave boy who lives in a plantation; he is very young (don't know exactly the age but he is still working little jobs around, so I believe he is nothing more than a child). One day, near the briar patch he sees a strange man. Israel believes him to be the Devil, even if the man reassures him that it's not true. But from that moment on, Israel's life is no more the same and terrible things happen around him. Maybe the man was not the devil, but probably he opens Israel's eyes to who he is and where he stays, and that was worst than a damnation.<br /><br />Etiolate: Oliver is an African American artist; as an artist, with an artist's eyes, he likes the pretty thing, above all the pretty boys. But Oliver is not an handsome man and he is not even wealthy and famous, and so the pretty boys don't like him. One more night he sees the reject in the eyes of one of that boys, and probably his desire is so strong that he unveal something terrible, a curse or similar... or maybe he only frees his true self, one who sees the beauty also in the horror of death.<br /><br />Her Spirit Hovering: Howard was a young man with big dreams of becoming a famous and adored artist. He had the skills, he was good, but he had also a overbearing mother who always crushed his dreams. Not only that she also managed to ruin every important relationship Howard had, first with Kamela, a young Indian girl he met at school (and being of a different culture was not good for his mother) and then with Ned, a talented man he lived with (and obviously being a man was not good for his mother). Now his mother is passed away, and Ned is probably thinking that he know can start living, but grudge and regret are bigger than the wish to start, and the weight of his presence is almost as present as when she was alive. But it's true that it's all his mother's fault, or maybe it's Howard that doesn't have the courage to take his life in his hands?<br /><br />Come Join Me: Aime is a young boy with a gift, he can see the spirits of his dead relatives. But only his grandmother thinks at that like a gift, all the others, his mother first, want to cure him. Will Aime learn to live with his spirit friends, or will he join them?<br /><br />Sea, Swallow Me: Jed has always searched for something, someone bigger than life. And maybe he finally meets him in a seaside village, in the deep of the sea.<br /><br />Circus Boy Without a Safety Net: C.B. is a boy with a wonderful voice and a love for the old stars, in particular Lena Horne. When he was young his parents supported his dream allowing him to dream day and night about his favorite star, but when he became a young man, a teen, and this passion still was wih him, they feared him being gay and try to repress his dreams. He was a good singer, but he couldn't be himself in the choir of the church. When C.B. finally will leave home and enter the unknown world of New York, so far and strange in comparison to his little town, will he be finally free?<br /><br />Strange Alphabets: in this short story the author romances a moment in the life of Arthur Rimbaud, when he first left his family home and his mother to find his true self in the big and alluring Paris. Arthur will learn that being free it is not always so good, and great pain will wait him, but the lure of poetry and the extasy of flesh is too strong to resist.<br /><br />Magpie Sisters: a little scene on a little thief girl who is drawn by shiny little thing.<br /><br />A Bird of Ice: Ryuichi is a Japanese monk; he lives in a peaceful monastery along a lake and one day he "saves" a swan which is drowning. Despite the warning of his brother, he takes care of the animal, and he is strangely attracted but it. And when the animal leaves, it marks Ryuichi with a kiss / bite. From that moment on Ryuichi is no more the same and he will have to see deeply inside himself to understand what he wants and who he is.<br /><br />Catch Him by the Toe: Sambo is an African tamer and Simba is his beautiful Asian tiger; Sambo and Simba, Africa and Asia, man and animal, they are both strange and beautiful. Maybe too strange and beautiful for the little American town of Azalea, which can't see beyond its own fear of what is unknown and extraordinaire.<br /><br />As I said, the anthology is not simple, but it's mesmerizing. It's full of color and flavor, an intoxicating mix that catches you while reading and lingers afterward. All the tales are mostly sad, but not without hope; the romance is not the target of the characters and so it's not even the final point of the stories; they are almost all self discovery journey, and the ending point of the journey not always is a light and beautiful paradise.<br /><br /><a target="_blank" href="http://www.amazon.com/dp/1590210662/?tag=elimyrevandra-20" rel="nofollow">http://www.amazon.com/dp/1590210662/?...</a></span>
  <a data-text-id="14930025428049609305" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_56152474'><a id="like_count_review_56152474" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/56152474?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">1 like</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3834230-sea-swallow-me-and-other-stories">Like</a></span>

  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >
    <div class="section">


<div id="review_2342168403" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2342168403" />
    <a title="Ian Casey" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/39512822-ian-casey"><img alt="Ian Casey" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1422075320p2/39512822.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2342168403?book_show_action=true">Apr 04, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Ian Casey" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Ian Casey" href="/user/show/39512822-ian-casey">Ian Casey</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="ebook 9781452427737" href="/book/show/21724441-sea-swallow-me-and-other-stories">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2342168403" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer4871906114801059563">Craig Gidney's debut collection of what may be reductively and inadequately described as 'dark fantasy' is an impressively accomplished one. His voice is one that speaks to both the gay perspective and the black American one, and to the complex intersections between them, but not at the expense of having a story worth telling or the skill to tell it.<br /><br />That may not be unique among writers, but it's sufficiently uncommon that I've yet to encounter it among Gidney's peers in this broad category of da</span>
  <span id="freeText4871906114801059563" style="display:none">Craig Gidney's debut collection of what may be reductively and inadequately described as 'dark fantasy' is an impressively accomplished one. His voice is one that speaks to both the gay perspective and the black American one, and to the complex intersections between them, but not at the expense of having a story worth telling or the skill to tell it.<br /><br />That may not be unique among writers, but it's sufficiently uncommon that I've yet to encounter it among Gidney's peers in this broad category of darker forms of short fiction. And there's a contradiction here which I've yet to adequately reconcile whereby I'm simultaneously glad of his fresh perspective and voice, and yet hoping for the day wherein it won't be at all remarkable.<br /><br />These stories are surprisingly diverse for the early output of an author, as Gidney flows easily from the oneiric to the realist and from his contemporary USA to an antiquated Asian monastery. There's no sense of contradiction in it though, so deft is his execution. Even in the midst of the fantastical or the horrific one has a feeling of emotional sincerity from his characters.<br /><br />This is particularly apparent in the more realist-leaning Bildungsroman 'Circus-Boy without a Safety Net', which is frankly heart-rending in its portrayal of a homosexual boy in Christian America. It certainly suggests hints of autobiography. But this emotionally engaging characterisation is found in all of the stories to a greater or lesser degree, and marks Gidney apart from the average horror or fantasy author.<br /><br />Better copy editing would have been nice. The story 'A Bird of Ice' seems particularly prone to typos that could have been picked up by a proofreader who was half awake. And like any author, Gidney has his share of quirks such as saying 'bought' instead of 'brought' and 'lightening' instead of 'lightning'. Thankfully his prose is mellifluous and charming enough to carry the reader through such distractions.<br /><br />At first glance, Gidney's work may seem a little niche, but if anything I think he has the skillset and the style to appeal to a broader audience outside genre than most of his peers. This is an excellent debut collection.</span>
  <a data-text-id="4871906114801059563" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1510188440" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1510188440" />
    <a title="Michael Adams" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/14903006-michael-adams"><img alt="Michael Adams" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1434953895p2/14903006.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1510188440?book_show_action=true">Jan 14, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Michael Adams" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Michael Adams" href="/user/show/14903006-michael-adams">Michael Adams</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14903006-michael-adams?shelf=literate-fantasy">literate-fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14903006-michael-adams?shelf=modern-fantasy">modern-fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14903006-michael-adams?shelf=modern-weird-fiction">modern-weird-fiction</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14903006-michael-adams?shelf=strange-stories">strange-stories</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14903006-michael-adams?shelf=urban-fantasy">urban-fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14903006-michael-adams?shelf=exotic-fantasy">exotic-fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14903006-michael-adams?shelf=ghost-stories">ghost-stories</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14903006-michael-adams?shelf=fairy-tales">fairy-tales</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14903006-michael-adams?shelf=magic-realism">magic-realism</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1510188440" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer13729713927600040932">Stunning collection of short stories. Many are written from the perspective of gay, black men, but not entirely so. Gender identity, sexuality, religion, culture, and race are all strong elements of Gidney's work, however, and are handled deftly and compassionately throughout. All of the stories feature elegant, well crafted, highly poetic prose, and have a touch of the supernatural to them. Characters in these tales venture into fairy-tale like moral lessons, and confront mythic personification</span>
  <span id="freeText13729713927600040932" style="display:none">Stunning collection of short stories. Many are written from the perspective of gay, black men, but not entirely so. Gender identity, sexuality, religion, culture, and race are all strong elements of Gidney's work, however, and are handled deftly and compassionately throughout. All of the stories feature elegant, well crafted, highly poetic prose, and have a touch of the supernatural to them. Characters in these tales venture into fairy-tale like moral lessons, and confront mythic personifications of human fears and desires. The stories range from urban fantasy, to dark erotica, and even to the traditional ghost-story end of the spectrum. There are some incredibly powerful and important works in the collection, and any fan of speculative literature would be better for having read them.</span>
  <a data-text-id="13729713927600040932" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1510188440'><a id="like_count_review_1510188440" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1510188440?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">1 like</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3834230-sea-swallow-me-and-other-stories">Like</a></span>

<div id="review_945544396" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/945544396" />
    <a title="Patrick Niemeyer" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/12857622-patrick-niemeyer"><img alt="Patrick Niemeyer" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1448080577p2/12857622.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/945544396?book_show_action=true">May 22, 2014</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Patrick Niemeyer" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Patrick Niemeyer" href="/user/show/12857622-patrick-niemeyer">Patrick Niemeyer</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer945544396" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer5302257145804643967">My only beef with this book is the typos. They're everywhere, and if a casual reader who isn't even looking for typos can spot them left and right, you know you have a problem. That said, it's a really good book. Craig Laurance Gidney weaves together fantasy, folklore, and reality so deftly that it's quite easy to get lost in his world. It's definitely not light reading, nor would I recommend it to anyone who can't handle a little sex and violence. But it's gorgeous work all the same. Without ge</span>
  <span id="freeText5302257145804643967" style="display:none">My only beef with this book is the typos. They're everywhere, and if a casual reader who isn't even looking for typos can spot them left and right, you know you have a problem. That said, it's a really good book. Craig Laurance Gidney weaves together fantasy, folklore, and reality so deftly that it's quite easy to get lost in his world. It's definitely not light reading, nor would I recommend it to anyone who can't handle a little sex and violence. But it's gorgeous work all the same. Without getting too preachy, Gidney shows how race and sexuality shape our identities, always have, always will. It's not always pretty. But it's pretty consistent, whether the story is set in present-day America or Japan or the antebellum South. This is a really good book. I hope it finds a wider audience.</span>
  <a data-text-id="5302257145804643967" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_1665239663" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1665239663" />
    <a title="CaseyTheCanadianLesbrarian" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian"><img alt="CaseyTheCanadianLesbrarian" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1483644713p2/10463035.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1665239663?book_show_action=true">Jun 10, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="CaseyTheCanadianLesbrarian" class="user" itemprop="url" name="CaseyTheCanadianLesbrarian" href="/user/show/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian">CaseyTheCanadianLesbrarian</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=american">american</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=black">black</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=short-stories">short-stories</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=queer">queer</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=gay">gay</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=audiobooks">audiobooks</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=magic-realism">magic-realism</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian?shelf=reading-in-colour">reading-in-colour</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1665239663" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer1487721166036473760">Wildly inventive and gorgeously written. I don't often reread books, but I would love to pick this up in print form so I could linger over the language more. That said, the audiobook is beautifully and feelingly narrated. <br />This is top-notch speculative fiction. Don't miss it!!</span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_109706441" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/109706441" />
    <a title="Sean Meriwether" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3748306-sean-meriwether"><img alt="Sean Meriwether" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479315249p2/3748306.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/109706441?book_show_action=true">Jun 06, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Sean Meriwether" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Sean Meriwether" href="/user/show/3748306-sean-meriwether">Sean Meriwether</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3748306-sean-meriwether?shelf=short-stories">short-stories</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3748306-sean-meriwether?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3748306-sean-meriwether?shelf=authors-i-ve-met">authors-i-ve-met</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3748306-sean-meriwether?shelf=lgtbq">lgtbq</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer109706441" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer5648523157411001353">Short story collections can be challenging to review since they often span genres, styles and periods. Some stories are naturally going to be more appealing to some readers than others. Gidney’s collection is no different, but there are several threads that are woven into his collection, <i>Sea, Swallow Me</i>. The first is music, which sets the pulse of each story. Whether it is ethereal music sung live in concert or overheard at a bar, or unearthly songs sung by the devil or a bewitched group of pari</span>
  <span id="freeText5648523157411001353" style="display:none">Short story collections can be challenging to review since they often span genres, styles and periods. Some stories are naturally going to be more appealing to some readers than others. Gidney’s collection is no different, but there are several threads that are woven into his collection, <i>Sea, Swallow Me</i>. The first is music, which sets the pulse of each story. Whether it is ethereal music sung live in concert or overheard at a bar, or unearthly songs sung by the devil or a bewitched group of parishioners summing up the god of the sea, Gidney’s writing flows with lyricism. The second thread is the supernatural, with characters who have second sight or who encounter the supernatural, but the stories stay rooted in reality by focusing on some of the mundane details that makes them believable. The final thread that ties this collection, and for me the most interesting, is that all the work is told from the point of view of the Other, outsiders who don’t quite fit (and often choose not to). The collection also bridges society's self-determined divisions of gender, sexuality, and race. Where I saw Gidney shine was in the opening story, “The Safety of Thorns”, where Israel Jones, an orphan child in a southern slave state, encounters a folkloric devil and his wife; the story is at turns sensual, dreamlike and sad and left the strongest haunting impression.</span>
  <a data-text-id="5648523157411001353" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_2181140643" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2181140643" />
    <a title="Michael" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1152647-michael"><img alt="Michael" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1508937952p2/1152647.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2181140643?book_show_action=true">Jan 18, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Michael" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Michael" href="/user/show/1152647-michael">Michael</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1152647-michael?shelf=2018-challenge">2018-challenge</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1152647-michael?shelf=lgbt">lgbt</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2181140643" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer5852991717518684">Reading Challenge 2018: book set at sea. This delightful book of short stories includes mythological creatures and deities from pantheons that are not often discussed. Orisha from Africa, kami and yosei from Japan. The language was elegant and description, providing mental pictures of the story. The style reminded me of Barker's erotic horror stories. The tales were unique and fresh, leaving me with my thoughts as I tried to wrap my head around them. I will definitely seek out more from this aut</span>
  <span id="freeText5852991717518684" style="display:none">Reading Challenge 2018: book set at sea. This delightful book of short stories includes mythological creatures and deities from pantheons that are not often discussed. Orisha from Africa, kami and yosei from Japan. The language was elegant and description, providing mental pictures of the story. The style reminded me of Barker's erotic horror stories. The tales were unique and fresh, leaving me with my thoughts as I tried to wrap my head around them. I will definitely seek out more from this author.</span>
  <a data-text-id="5852991717518684" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_138826802" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/138826802" />
    <a title="Travis" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4761577-travis"><img alt="Travis" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1507859363p2/4761577.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/138826802?book_show_action=true">Jan 06, 2011</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Travis" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Travis" href="/user/show/4761577-travis">Travis</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was ok"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4761577-travis?shelf=2011">2011</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4761577-travis?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer138826802" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer5914623021553098610">Honestly I wasn't really impressed with this book. There were a few stories I really liked and the rest were just okay. Also, the copy I have is an ARC, so it's got a lot of mistakes, which hopefully were corrected in the final proof (the most annoying one was in the Japanese story, where Amaterasu was misspelled as Amaratsu throughout the story).</span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/859095-tyrannosaurus-regina?shelf=short-stories">short-stories</a>,

              <span id="reviewTextContainer1009286361" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer2753833811400777338">While not everything worked equally well for me, which is usually the case with collections, I thought "Circus-Boy Without a Safety Net" was wonderful, and closing the collection with "Catch Him By the Toe" left a deep and lasting impression.</span>

          </span>

<div class='bookAuthorProfile__about'>

<span id="freeTextContainer10061223098697027839">Author of SEA, SWALLOW ME &amp; OTHER STORIES (Lethe Press) . l BEREFT (Tiny Satchel Press), . SKIN DEEP MAGIC (Rebel Satori Press), THE NECTAR OF NIGHTMARES (Dim Shores Publications). Numerous short stories.<br />Free fiction available at Wattpad: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.wattpad.com/user/CraigGidney" rel="nofollow">http://www.wattpad.com/user/CraigGidney</a></span>

      $('rating_details').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });
      $('rating_details').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

//]]>
</script><span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
<a class="gr-hyperlink" href="#other_reviews">
  <meta itemprop="ratingCount" content="9">
  <span class="votes value-title" title="9">
    9
  </span>
  Ratings

<a class="gr-hyperlink" href="#other_reviews">
    <span class="count value-title" title="1">
      1
    </span>
    Review
</a>
</div>

<div id="descriptionContainer">

      <div id="description" class="readable stacked" style="right:0">

<span id="freeTextContainer17446815648753274526">Hexes in the subway station. Monsters in alleyways. Rituals in the back room at your local pizza place. Magic is everywhere you look in the city, if you look closely enough.<br /><br />These eleven stories take the glamour off of cities as you know them to reveal the magic beneath. From selkies and sweets in Saint Thomas to secret-spilling potions in Brasília to faeries and werewolves</span>
  <span id="freeText17446815648753274526" style="display:none">Hexes in the subway station. Monsters in alleyways. Rituals in the back room at your local pizza place. Magic is everywhere you look in the city, if you look closely enough.<br /><br />These eleven stories take the glamour off of cities as you know them to reveal the magic beneath. From selkies and sweets in Saint Thomas to secret-spilling potions in Brasília to faeries and werewolves in Toronto, you’ll find that magic and the myriad kinds of people who create it are right where they always have been: everywhere around you. Explore the world as you’ve never seen it, or maybe the way you’ve always known it to be—full of magic and people as diverse and as beautiful as the world itself.<br /><br />ur·ban fan·ta·sy (ər-bən fan-tə-sē), n.<br /><br />Describes a work that is set primarily in the real world and contains aspects of fantasy. Although stories may be set in contemporary times, this characteristic is not necessary for the fiction to be considered urban fantasy, as works of the genre may also take place in futuristic and historical settings, real or imagined.<br />(Wikipedia)<br />More than anything, UNDERCITIES looks for stories that weave the magic of urban fantasy together with positive interpretations of race and queer sexuality. Fantasy is not homogenous; it is as diverse and imaginative and real as the LGBTQ+ authors and authors of color who create it. It is a place where anything can happen—and why not make it a space where everyone and anyone can overcome obstacles, win battles, and experience happenings beyond their wildest dreams?<br /><br />Literature has always been a place where reality meets the fantastical. UNDERCITIES intends to reflect that. The stories presented in UNDERCITIES are reflections of our world as they could and should be; they combine the impossible daring of magic with the experiences of the people with whom we share the world and put the voices of LGBTQ+ creators and creators of color at the forefront of these narratives. Each short story presented in UNDERCITIES presents a different point of view and a different experience—and each of these stories is as diverse and incredible as the authors who created them.</span>
  <a data-text-id="17446815648753274526" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

      </div>
</div>
