      $('rating_details_tip').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });
      $('rating_details_tip').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2129563940" />

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Morgan" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Morgan" href="/user/show/31897893-morgan">Morgan</a>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback " href="/book/show/35262997-undercities-anthology">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2129563940" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer9048042436199840802">I had no idea this was on here but holy shit!! My short story is featured in this anthology along with ten other incredible authors. It was so much fun to write and I hope that everyone enjoys it.</span>

          </span>
        </div>

      <div id="aboutAuthor" class=" clearFloats bigBox"><div class="h2Container gradientHeaderContainer"><h2 class="brownBackground"><a href="/author/show/16835683.Femi_Sobowale">About Femi Sobowale</a></h2></div><div class="bigBoxBody"><div class="bigBoxContent containerWithHeaderContent">
          <div class='bookAuthorProfile'>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__topContainer'>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__photoContainer'>

        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});

<div id="descriptionContainer">

      <div id="description" class="readable stacked" style="right:0">

<span id="freeTextContainer12948549553774503863"><i>Love Beyond Body, Space, and Time</i> is a collection of indigenous science fiction and urban fantasy focusing on LGBT and two-spirit characters. These stories range from a transgender woman undergoing an experimental transition process to young lovers separated through decades and meeting in their own far future. These are stories of machines and magic, love and self-love. <br /><br />St</span>
  <span id="freeText12948549553774503863" style="display:none"><i>Love Beyond Body, Space, and Time</i> is a collection of indigenous science fiction and urban fantasy focusing on LGBT and two-spirit characters. These stories range from a transgender woman undergoing an experimental transition process to young lovers separated through decades and meeting in their own far future. These are stories of machines and magic, love and self-love. <br /><br />Stories featured are by an all-star cast of writers including: <br />Cherie Dimaline (The Girl Who Grew a Galaxy, Red Rooms) <br />Gwen Benaway (Ceremonies for the Dead) <br />David Robertson (Betty: The Helen Betty Osborne Story, Tales From Big Spirit) <br />Richard Van Camp (The Lesser Blessed, Three Feathers) <br />Nathan Adler (Wrist) <br />Daniel Heath Justice (The Way of Thorn and Thunder: The Kynship Chronicles) <br />Darcie Little Badger (Nkásht íí, The Sea Under Texas) <br />Cleo Keahna</span>
  <a data-text-id="12948549553774503863" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

      </div>
</div>

      $('edition_31560094').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('edition_31560094').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('edition_31560094').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('edition_31560094').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

</script></div>
</li>
</ul>

<div id="review_1744191554" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1744191554" />
    <a title="Debbie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1033854-debbie"><img alt="Debbie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1308403968p2/1033854.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1744191554?book_show_action=true">Aug 31, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Debbie" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Debbie" href="/user/show/1033854-debbie">Debbie</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1744191554" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer4557484626763793697">Most depictions of Native peoples are by people who aren't Native... people who feel compelled to create Native characters and stories, but who do so from a place of good intentions shaped by hundreds of years of misrepresentations of who we were, and who we are. As a Native scholar and literary critic working primarily in children's and young adult literature, I often feel quite raw after reading one starred messed up book after another about Native peoples. <br /><br />With that as context, I gotta say th</span>
  <span id="freeText4557484626763793697" style="display:none">Most depictions of Native peoples are by people who aren't Native... people who feel compelled to create Native characters and stories, but who do so from a place of good intentions shaped by hundreds of years of misrepresentations of who we were, and who we are. As a Native scholar and literary critic working primarily in children's and young adult literature, I often feel quite raw after reading one starred messed up book after another about Native peoples. <br /><br />With that as context, I gotta say that as I read LOVE BEYOND BODY, SPACE, AND TIME, I felt loved by the stories. They're real. Over and over, my heart swelled as I met new characters and imagined these characters in the places their creators put them. <br /><br />The writers are Native. That's where they start, as writers, and that infuses their stories. There's no sentimental words. There's no tragic ones. There's no detribalized Indians. These characters are like the Native people I know. <br /><br />I'd like every single person working in literature, as a writer, an editor, or a reviewer, to get a copy and see what Native voice is like. These writers show you how it is done. <br /><br />I did a Storify of my tweets, as I read the anthology. It doesn't have any spoilers. It does have some context for the stories and the collection.<br /><a target="_blank" href="https://storify.com/Debbie_Reese/being-loved-by-story" rel="nofollow">https://storify.com/Debbie_Reese/bein...</a> <br /><br /></span>
  <a data-text-id="4557484626763793697" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1743698184?book_show_action=true">Jul 02, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="CaseyTheCanadianLesbrarian" class="user" itemprop="url" name="CaseyTheCanadianLesbrarian" href="/user/show/10463035-caseythecanadianlesbrarian">CaseyTheCanadianLesbrarian</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">

        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1743698184" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer15378188004020830056">Some really great stories in here! And not a bad one in the bunch! I'd call this more a collection of speculative fiction rather than strict science fiction, so there's something in here for you even if you're not a hard SF fan. <a href="https://caseythecanadianlesbrarian.com/2017/07/12/two-spirit-futures-a-review-of-love-beyond-body-space-time-an-indigenous-lgbt-sci-fi-anthology/" rel="nofollow">Full review here</a></span>

<div id="review_1735491002" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1735491002" />
    <a title="Shira Glassman" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22722961-shira-glassman"><img alt="Shira Glassman" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442944087p2/22722961.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1735491002?book_show_action=true">Apr 16, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Shira Glassman" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Shira Glassman" href="/user/show/22722961-shira-glassman">Shira Glassman</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>


          <div>
    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Shira by: </span>
      everyone lol
  </div>



          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22722961-shira-glassman?shelf=qwoc">qwoc</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22722961-shira-glassman?shelf=sff-speculative">sff-speculative</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22722961-shira-glassman?shelf=trans">trans</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22722961-shira-glassman?shelf=ff-sff">ff-sff</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22722961-shira-glassman?shelf=femslash">femslash</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1735491002" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer12934322544546117837">My favorite story in the <i>Love Beyond Body, Space, &amp; Time</i> collection is cis f/f fluff by Darcie Little Badger, about which she says, "<b>Né łe</b> is a lighthearted story about lesbians and puppies in space." Forty chihuahas (and one husky!) need care when the dog stasis on the transport to Mars malfunctions and they all wake up, so the crew wakes up one of the human passengers, an Apache veterinarian on her way to the Martian colony to start over after a breakup. Really, does anything I say here ma</span>
  <span id="freeText12934322544546117837" style="display:none">My favorite story in the <i>Love Beyond Body, Space, &amp; Time</i> collection is cis f/f fluff by Darcie Little Badger, about which she says, "<b>Né łe</b> is a lighthearted story about lesbians and puppies in space." Forty chihuahas (and one husky!) need care when the dog stasis on the transport to Mars malfunctions and they all wake up, so the crew wakes up one of the human passengers, an Apache veterinarian on her way to the Martian colony to start over after a breakup. Really, does anything I say here matter after "lesbians and puppies in space"? If you follow me there's a good chance you're after fluffy queer SFF, and the whole anthology is only five dollars, so go and buy it just on the strength of this one alone.<br /><br />I also really enjoyed Gwen Benaway's <b>"Transitions"</b>, about a Métis trans woman contemplating the difference between medical, "modern" transition and the traditional forms of transition that are part of her people's tradition, which she initially resists. As a queer person of a marginalized faith, I really enjoy faith-positive queer narratives and non-Christian LGBTQ+ inspie so the story really sang to me on that level. Plus, it has the value of being a voice from within along multiple axes, and a well-constructed narrative structure. The leading lady also discusses policing of women's bodies both internal and external, which is something universal to the female experience trans and cis alike.<br /><br />There is a great deal of appeal for me in the symbolism of <b>"The Boys Who Became the Hummingbirds"</b> by Daniel Heath Justice. It's not about literal hummingbirds but more about recognizing kinship with others who are different in the same way you are. <br /><br /><b>"Valediction at the Star View Motel"</b> by Nathan Adler is YA, or maybe NA, starring a "white" girl who's been adopted into an Indigenous tribe as a result of being in the foster care system and came back to stay with them once her foster time was up. She and another girl hook up in an abandoned motel that belonged to someone important to her, and there's some stuff about being able to talk to spiders/references to <i>Charlotte's Web</i>. This one did a really good job of resonating with me on a sapphic level.<br /><br />The other stories are pretty good, too, and kept my attention although the ones above are the ones that will stick with me; I will mention that "Imposter Syndrome" was too "gritty hard sci-fi" for me to understand so that one needs a different reviewer. There is more f/f than just the two stories I singled out, so if you're following me for that, you'll get what you're after with this collection.</span>
  <a data-text-id="12934322544546117837" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_1996452233" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1996452233" />
    <a title="Romie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/33510193-romie"><img alt="Romie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1529679881p2/33510193.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1996452233?book_show_action=true">Jun 30, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Romie" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Romie" href="/user/show/33510193-romie">Romie</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33510193-romie?shelf=fantasy-scifi-punks">fantasy-scifi-punks</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33510193-romie?shelf=rainbow-community">rainbow-community</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33510193-romie?shelf=representation-matters">representation-matters</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33510193-romie?shelf=the-book-bound-society">the-book-bound-society</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1996452233" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer1168791503305043048"><i>Aliens</i>, by Richard Van Camp<br />4/5 Definitely a beautiful story with a Two-Spirited character<br />Legends are made, not born, by Cherie Dimaline 2/5 Didn’t really understand what this story was about . . . <br /><i>Perfectly you</i>, by David A. Robertson<br />4.5/5 OMG I LOVED THIS ONE! It shows how important it is to enjoy your life while you can<br /><i>The boys who became the hummingbirds</i>, by Daniel Heath Justice<br />5/5 Definitely my favourite! This story is about being who you truly are, and not being ashamed of it. And you should</span>
  <span id="freeText1168791503305043048" style="display:none"><i>Aliens</i>, by Richard Van Camp<br />4/5 Definitely a beautiful story with a Two-Spirited character<br />Legends are made, not born, by Cherie Dimaline 2/5 Didn’t really understand what this story was about . . . <br /><i>Perfectly you</i>, by David A. Robertson<br />4.5/5 OMG I LOVED THIS ONE! It shows how important it is to enjoy your life while you can<br /><i>The boys who became the hummingbirds</i>, by Daniel Heath Justice<br />5/5 Definitely my favourite! This story is about being who you truly are, and not being ashamed of it. And you should spread this message : be unique and beautiful, don’t be afraid of what’s to come, together we’re stronger than those who want to keep us in a cage.<br /><i>Néle</i>, by Darcie Little Badger<br />3/5 Okay that was . . . cute I guess?<br /><i>Transitions</i>, by Gwen Benaway<br />2.5/5 This story got me so confused . . . Seriously I don’t know what to think.<br /><i>Imposter syndrome</i>, by Mari Kurisato<br />2/5 I don’t even know what to say about this story . . . I think the point was ‘people are afraid of what’s different’ but I’m not exactly sure.<br /><i>Valediction at the star view motel</i>, by Nathan Adler<br />4/5 Definitely liked this one! This story shows you’re more than what you look like.</span>

<div id="review_1744661074" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1744661074" />
    <a title="Chasia Lloyd" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/39653504-chasia-lloyd"><img alt="Chasia Lloyd" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464695510p2/39653504.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1744661074?book_show_action=true">Aug 31, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Chasia Lloyd" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Chasia Lloyd" href="/user/show/39653504-chasia-lloyd">Chasia Lloyd</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1744661074" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer14414491939331131126">I wasn't sure what I was getting into when I requested an e-ARC for this sci-fi anthology from Indigenous writers, most who identify somewhere on the QUILTBAG &amp; two-spirit spectrum. My exposure to such an intersection is pathetically close to zero. But I hope this anthology will inspire more publishers to buy works from queer, Indigenous SFF writers, because the world needs more of this.<br /><br />We have some great openings from Hope Nicholson, Grace L. Dillon, and Niigaanwewidam James Sinclair before</span>
  <span id="freeText14414491939331131126" style="display:none">I wasn't sure what I was getting into when I requested an e-ARC for this sci-fi anthology from Indigenous writers, most who identify somewhere on the QUILTBAG &amp; two-spirit spectrum. My exposure to such an intersection is pathetically close to zero. But I hope this anthology will inspire more publishers to buy works from queer, Indigenous SFF writers, because the world needs more of this.<br /><br />We have some great openings from Hope Nicholson, Grace L. Dillon, and Niigaanwewidam James Sinclair before we get into the heart of the book. So many powerful stories are told in so few pages in Love Beyond Body, Space, and Time. As the title suggests, love is the main theme in this collection. Romantic love, familial love, self-love. Hope is a prevalent driving force. There are a few sad, quiet moments and some explosive flares, but the stories themselves are uplifting. I'm sure I missed a lot of layers to these stories as a white, non-Native person, but I adored each and every piece here.<br /><br />- "Aliens" is a voice-y dream, a great start to the anthology.<br />- "Legends Are Made, Not Born" brings us the memorable Auntie Dave.<br />- My heart wibbled so much during "Perfectly You", aching for Emma and Cassie to find each other.<br />- The writing in "The Boy Who Became Hummingbirds" is absolutely gorgeous.<br />- "Né łe" might be my favorite in the bunch - slowburn romance + so many dogs + space!!<br />- "Transitions" was very moving, so deep.<br />- The most action-y story here would be "Imposter Syndrome", and it is quite a rollercoaster ride.<br />- "Valedictorian at The Star View Motel" has the most shippable couple, aghhh, Edie and Mushkeg!!!<br />- We end the collection with an incredible poem "Parallax" by Cleo Keahna.<br /><br />These characters and their aches and dreams are forever seared into my soul.<br /><br />***e-ARC provided by NetGalley***</span>
  <a data-text-id="14414491939331131126" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1743346201" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1743346201" />
    <a title="Rie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1376343-rie"><img alt="Rie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477601748p2/1376343.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1743346201?book_show_action=true">Aug 30, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Rie" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Rie" href="/user/show/1376343-rie">Rie</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1743346201" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer3095208078827601126">A beautiful and necessary book. Hope Nicholson, in her editors' intro, says: <br /><br />"Stories, when they're told, have an enormous opportunity to connect people, to bind hearts and minds and stories, to make one feel like they're not alone. I strongly believe in this."<br /><br />As an anthology, I believe every reader will find something to connect with. As I believe firmly in letting the authors words speak for themselves, let me quote my favorites, the heartwarming “Né łe!" by Darcie Little Badger (dogs and wlw</span>
  <span id="freeText3095208078827601126" style="display:none">A beautiful and necessary book. Hope Nicholson, in her editors' intro, says: <br /><br />"Stories, when they're told, have an enormous opportunity to connect people, to bind hearts and minds and stories, to make one feel like they're not alone. I strongly believe in this."<br /><br />As an anthology, I believe every reader will find something to connect with. As I believe firmly in letting the authors words speak for themselves, let me quote my favorites, the heartwarming “Né łe!" by Darcie Little Badger (dogs and wlw and new hope in space!):<br /><br />"Could I manage the first animal clinic on Mars? Support a burgeoning pet population? First dogs and then cats and then potbellied pigs! Goats, bison, passenger pigeons: dense flocks migrating through engineered skies. I'd build a paradise, one better than the home I lost as a child,"<br /><br />And the transcendent "The Boys Who Became the Hummingbirds" by Daniel Heath Justice:<br /><br />"So they darted to those whose hearts beat strongest, streaks of blinding bright grace, calling to them in soft voices, sharing stories of possibility beyond the grim dust of what was to be a hopeful possibility of what could be. And some of their kindred responded to the long-awaited call, body changing to echo spirit, becoming more themselves than they had darted imagine, rising up and out of shame to join the Hummingbird Boys...."<br /><br />If you love speculative fiction, absolutely add to your collection.<br /><br />[I received this book from Netgalley in return for an honest review.]</span>
  <a data-text-id="3095208078827601126" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_2155071829" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2155071829" />
    <a title="autumn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13185499-autumn"><img alt="autumn" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1496582509p2/13185499.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2155071829?book_show_action=true">Nov 17, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="autumn" class="user" itemprop="url" name="autumn" href="/user/show/13185499-autumn">autumn</a>
      </span>

          added it


          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13185499-autumn?shelf=author-of-color">author-of-color</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13185499-autumn?shelf=ch-of-color">ch-of-color</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13185499-autumn?shelf=lgbt-author">lgbt-author</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13185499-autumn?shelf=lgbt-ch">lgbt-ch</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2155071829" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer11575606264737932932">i really liked almost all the stories in this! my favorites were Né łe, Valediction at the Star View Hotel, and especially The Boys Who Became the Hummingbirds. I also really appreciated that a lot (more than half) of the stories were about trans characters - in 'lgbt' anthologies (and 'lgbt' stories in general) like this it's usually at least 99% cis gay people.</span>

          </span>
        </div>

        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1802918225?book_show_action=true">Nov 04, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Glaiza" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Glaiza" href="/user/show/3876682-glaiza">Glaiza</a>

        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">

              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3876682-glaiza?shelf=speculative-fiction">speculative-fiction</a>,

              >

<span id="freeTextContainer13404999056948726995">"So they darted to those whose hearts beat strongest, streaks of blinding bright grace, calling to them in soft voices, sharing stories of possibility beyond the grim dust of what was to a hopeful possibility of what could be."<br /><br /><i>- The Boys Who Became The Hummingbirds, Daniel Heath Justice</i><br /><br />I wish I could have spent more time in each of the speculative worlds as I was so immersed in the different tensions, joys and resolutions of each one.<br /><br />Cont'd on the blog: <a target="_blank" href="https://paperwanderer.wordpress.com/2016/11/24/love-beyond-body-space-and-time-an-indigenous-lgbt-sci-fi-anthology/" rel="nofollow">https://paperwanderer.wordpress.com/2...</a></span>

<div id="review_1752029758" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1752029758" />
    <a title="Nicole Field" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4641407-nicole-field"><img alt="Nicole Field" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1462415079p2/4641407.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1752029758?book_show_action=true">Sep 08, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Nicole Field" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Nicole Field" href="/user/show/4641407-nicole-field">Nicole Field</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4641407-nicole-field?shelf=netgalley">netgalley</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1752029758" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer1640786807161591761"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461159808i/18832007._SX540_.png" alt="NetGalley Review" width="200" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I was really excited to read this anthology. Far too many books about persons of colour aren't written by the people they are representing. And to add to it, this book was specifically LGBTI? I was hooked. I grabbed it as soon as I saw it. <br><br>Unfortunately, the biggest problem I found was the order of the first four stories, put together in such a way that it seemed all the contributions to this anthology were a bit sameish. That's not the fault of the contributors, of course, but it made an inesca</span>
  <span id="freeText1640786807161591761" style="display:none"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461159808i/18832007._SX540_.png" alt="NetGalley Review" width="200" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I was really excited to read this anthology. Far too many books about persons of colour aren't written by the people they are representing. And to add to it, this book was specifically LGBTI? I was hooked. I grabbed it as soon as I saw it. <br><br>Unfortunately, the biggest problem I found was the order of the first four stories, put together in such a way that it seemed all the contributions to this anthology were a bit sameish. That's not the fault of the contributors, of course, but it made an inescapable first impression. The variety did, however, pick up in the second half of this anthology.<br><br>This is also the first anthology of LGBTI fiction I've ever read that had more lesbian romances than gay ones, a fact that made me incredibly happy. <br><br>There were several stories in this anthology that stood out for me:<br><br>It's not very often that the trope of waking up and finding it's all been a dream is a good move, but what about when that's stated at the beginning to be part of the plot? David A. Robertson's sci-fi short set in the not too distant future tells a story of a girl finally finding the courage to call the girl she likes. <br><br>The one that immediately follows that, <i>The Boys Who Became the Hummingbirds</i> tells an origin story filled with hope and just generally stayed in my mind. I think that's my favourite one from the set. <br><br>Another sci-fi/lesbian story in this anthology was by Darcie Little Badger telling the story of a romance builds between a pilot and a vet during a space voyage between Earth and Mars.<br><br>The final one that really stuck in my mind well after I'd finished the anthology was an incredibly short story of self love of someone who's just starting the second part of their transition from male to female.</span>
  <a data-text-id="1640786807161591761" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1752029758'><a id="like_count_review_1752029758" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1752029758?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">4 likes</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F31687523-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">Like</a></span>

<div id="review_1749810524" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1749810524" />
    <a title="Paul" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6971547-paul"><img alt="Paul" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1494252481p2/6971547.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1749810524?book_show_action=true">Sep 05, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Paul" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Paul" href="/user/show/6971547-paul">Paul</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1749810524" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer17138043571229877272">This is a great collection of stories. My favorite was probably IMPOSTER SYNDROME by Mari Kurisato, which is a great story that adds it's own unique elements to a "Philip k dick/cyberpunk"-ish kind of story. I would definitely recommend this collection to anyone who loves sci-fi &amp; fantasy</span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">


<tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1749810524">
  <td colspan="2">
    <div class="updateActionLinks">
        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1749810524" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1749810524&amp;resource_type=Review&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F31687523-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">flag</a>

<div id="review_1750661128" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1750661128" />
    <a title="K." class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/59378731-k"><img alt="K." src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_50x66-632230dc9882b4352d753eedf9396530.png" /></a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="K." class="user" itemprop="url" name="K." href="/user/show/59378731-k">K.</a>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1750661128" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer13900093645338842586">Wow this book is impressive. It's everything I've ever wanted. Native stories by Native authors, scifi and fantasy elements, LGBT and two-spirit characters...I didn't want it to end. I hope another anthology comes out in the future!</span>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_2519468253" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2519468253" />
    <a title="Elizabeth" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15541140-elizabeth"><img alt="Elizabeth" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468458682p2/15541140.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2519468253?book_show_action=true">Sep 11, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Elizabeth" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Elizabeth" href="/user/show/15541140-elizabeth">Elizabeth</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15541140-elizabeth?shelf=canadian-authors-or-literature">canadian-authors-or-literature</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15541140-elizabeth?shelf=women-writers">women-writers</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15541140-elizabeth?shelf=short-stories-novellas-anthologies">short-stories-novellas-anthologies</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15541140-elizabeth?shelf=science-fiction">science-fiction</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15541140-elizabeth?shelf=indigenous-writers-or-artists">indigenous-writers-or-artists</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15541140-elizabeth?shelf=lgbtq-stories-and-authors">lgbtq-stories-and-authors</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2519468253" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer5873438828117142226">Love Beyond Body, Space, and Time is an excellent collection of short stories, and its existence is completely necessary. I think marginalised communities deserve to be able to read more genre fiction about themselves, especially when there are so many ways that marginalised identities intersect. This anthology fills a gap that deserves to be filled.<br /><br />I was familiar with some of the writers in this anthology, and the ones I already knew were ones I already adored. Some of the others were entirely</span>
  <span id="freeText5873438828117142226" style="display:none">Love Beyond Body, Space, and Time is an excellent collection of short stories, and its existence is completely necessary. I think marginalised communities deserve to be able to read more genre fiction about themselves, especially when there are so many ways that marginalised identities intersect. This anthology fills a gap that deserves to be filled.<br /><br />I was familiar with some of the writers in this anthology, and the ones I already knew were ones I already adored. Some of the others were entirely new to me, and it was wonderful to get to read them for the first time. My two favourite stories by far were from David Alexander Robertson (an author I know and love) and Darcie Little Badger (an author who was new to me), with both of those stories really grabbing my attention and interest, and just resonating with me. I at least got some enjoyment out of every story in the collection.<br /><br />I definitely recommend this to anyone interested in either LGBTQ+ lit, indigenous lit, or sci-fi (or any combination of the three). I have definitely made note of some of the authors I would like to read more from. </span>
  <a data-text-id="5873438828117142226" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1757316588" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1757316588" />
    <a title="Lexie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/26698659-lexie"><img alt="Lexie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479243046p2/26698659.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1757316588?book_show_action=true">Sep 18, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Lexie" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Lexie" href="/user/show/26698659-lexie">Lexie</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26698659-lexie?shelf=lgbtq">lgbtq</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1757316588" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer6534736518036792724">*I received a copy of this on NetGalley<br /><br />This was such a beautiful book! I normally struggle to read short story anthologies, but every single story in this was so easy to read. They characters were all so unique and wonderful, and the world-building was especially impressive, given how short some of these stories were. Each one had so much heart, and I loved every single one. Reading this book felt like I was given an incredibly precious gift, and I am so thankful to have had the opportunity to r</span>
  <span id="freeText6534736518036792724" style="display:none">*I received a copy of this on NetGalley<br /><br />This was such a beautiful book! I normally struggle to read short story anthologies, but every single story in this was so easy to read. They characters were all so unique and wonderful, and the world-building was especially impressive, given how short some of these stories were. Each one had so much heart, and I loved every single one. Reading this book felt like I was given an incredibly precious gift, and I am so thankful to have had the opportunity to read it. </span>
  <a data-text-id="6534736518036792724" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>

          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2085293319" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer9491492703667829924"><a href="https://youtu.be/mTE7CRFoh2w?t=4m50s" rel="nofollow">Watch a mini-review in my August 2017 wrap up!</a><br /><br />I REALLY enjoyed this anthology! <br /><br />This book is an exploration of love in its many forms, and though I liked some stories more than others, all of them were evocative. This is an anthology that will make you FEEL. In particular I loved Né Łe by Darcie Little Badger--badass veterinarian in space? Ladies loving ladies? PUPPIES IN SPACE??? What more do you want?--and Transitions by Gwen Benaway--the end of this one, in particular, was just beautiful. I lo</span>
  <span id="freeText9491492703667829924" style="display:none"><a href="https://youtu.be/mTE7CRFoh2w?t=4m50s" rel="nofollow">Watch a mini-review in my August 2017 wrap up!</a><br /><br />I REALLY enjoyed this anthology! <br /><br />This book is an exploration of love in its many forms, and though I liked some stories more than others, all of them were evocative. This is an anthology that will make you FEEL. In particular I loved Né Łe by Darcie Little Badger--badass veterinarian in space? Ladies loving ladies? PUPPIES IN SPACE??? What more do you want?--and Transitions by Gwen Benaway--the end of this one, in particular, was just beautiful. I loved that all of these were speculative, and that most were sci-fi--a genre that despite its themes is too often reserved for white authors and white protagonists.<br /><br />A few of the stories weren't for me--the writing styles were very distinct, and I couldn't get into them. That's not to say they're poorly written, but rather that the authors were doing really interesting, new things with their narrative styles/voice, and they just happened to not be for me.<br /><br />All in all, this was a wonderful anthology that was a celebration of love and a celebration of American Indian and First Nation LGBT and two spirit voices. Definitely recommend!!</span>
  <a data-text-id="9491492703667829924" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1778558758" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1778558758" />
    <a title="Jenna" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/24879282-jenna"><img alt="Jenna" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476064106p2/24879282.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1778558758?book_show_action=true">Oct 07, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Jenna" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Jenna" href="/user/show/24879282-jenna">Jenna</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24879282-jenna?shelf=queer-lit">queer-lit</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24879282-jenna?shelf=native-lit">native-lit</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24879282-jenna?shelf=kindle">kindle</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24879282-jenna?shelf=writers-of-color">writers-of-color</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1778558758" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer10555032104467994349">Fantastic! There are times when I read Sci Fi and I am astounded by new ideas &amp; concepts. This was one of those experiences but enhanced even more because it's Native. A few of these stories made me feel like I was sitting &amp; listening to one of my grandma's or another tribal elder's stories. It's wonderful to find books like that - I don't often do. And all of this combined with queer characters and ideas. </span>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_1972809988" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1972809988" />
    <a title="Danielle Kraichy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/66939830-danielle-kraichy"><img alt="Danielle Kraichy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1492313933p2/66939830.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1972809988?book_show_action=true">Apr 15, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Danielle Kraichy" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Danielle Kraichy" href="/user/show/66939830-danielle-kraichy">Danielle Kraichy</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1972809988" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer6016091495003554023">I read so many amazing stories from this anthology. One in particular stuck with me and I even chose to bring two characters into the visual from our imagination by painting them (that's how much I enjoyed it!). Auntie Dave and the narrator from "Legends are Made, Not Born" (2016) by Cherie Dimaline (one of the many short stories in this collection) are beautiful people to imagine for our future and know in our present. <br /><br />Having the chance to explore different universes and read about Indigenous p</span>
  <span id="freeText6016091495003554023" style="display:none">I read so many amazing stories from this anthology. One in particular stuck with me and I even chose to bring two characters into the visual from our imagination by painting them (that's how much I enjoyed it!). Auntie Dave and the narrator from "Legends are Made, Not Born" (2016) by Cherie Dimaline (one of the many short stories in this collection) are beautiful people to imagine for our future and know in our present. <br /><br />Having the chance to explore different universes and read about Indigenous people interacting in a world of aliens, orbiters, and almost barren lands is now something I am hooked to read more of! <br /><br />Even if you’re pinched for time, not too into reading, or not usually interested in this specific genre please give this book a try as it is such an easy flowing read! The short stories also allow me to not feel tied down with reading the whole book at once as I can pick through the short stories and choose one for the day!<br /></span>
  <a data-text-id="6016091495003554023" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_1899576313" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1899576313" />
    <a title="Cara M" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1056291-cara-m"><img alt="Cara M" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1353979657p2/1056291.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1899576313?book_show_action=true">Sep 29, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Cara M" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Cara M" href="/user/show/1056291-cara-m">Cara M</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1056291-cara-m?shelf=heartfood">heartfood</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1056291-cara-m?shelf=heroine">heroine</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1899576313" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer10924025645617076058">the is a great collection of very different stories that still all feel cohesive as they explore different facets of love with Indigenous LGBTQ and two spirit characters. there are bright moments in each of the pieces within this anthology, and overall the collection felt hopeful even though it didn't shy away from the oppressions and microaggressions the characters faced. highly recommended!<br /><br />would also note what editor Hope Nicholson writes in the Letter from the Editor, talking about why some i</span>
  <span id="freeText10924025645617076058" style="display:none">the is a great collection of very different stories that still all feel cohesive as they explore different facets of love with Indigenous LGBTQ and two spirit characters. there are bright moments in each of the pieces within this anthology, and overall the collection felt hopeful even though it didn't shy away from the oppressions and microaggressions the characters faced. highly recommended!<br /><br />would also note what editor Hope Nicholson writes in the Letter from the Editor, talking about why some indigenous creators don't tell stories to those outside their communities: "Not all stories need to be shared, because the act of sharing makes them vulnerable to change and exploitation." as a non-indigenous reader, i approached this collection as a visitor grateful for the artists sharing their work. these are not stories to be consumed, they're stories to be received, and to me the distinction matters.</span>
  <a data-text-id="10924025645617076058" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_1942423379" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1942423379" />
    <a title="Heatherblakely" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4967433-heatherblakely"><img alt="Heatherblakely" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1484971273p2/4967433.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1942423379?book_show_action=true">Mar 12, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Heatherblakely" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Heatherblakely" href="/user/show/4967433-heatherblakely">Heatherblakely</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4967433-heatherblakely?shelf=lgbtq">lgbtq</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4967433-heatherblakely?shelf=own">own</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1942423379" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer12298857042763092642">3.5, rounding up. Pretty good collection--there were some stories I really, really liked, and some that bored me. If you can pick this up, definitely do so (right now it's $5 for the Kindle version and $10 for the paperback), because it'll help expand your horizons and introduce you to some new authors. My one big nitpicky thing was that I think the intro and forward from Niigaanwewidam James Sinclair and Grace Dillon should have come before Hope Nicholson's intro; I know she edited it and it's</span>
  <span id="freeText12298857042763092642" style="display:none">3.5, rounding up. Pretty good collection--there were some stories I really, really liked, and some that bored me. If you can pick this up, definitely do so (right now it's $5 for the Kindle version and $10 for the paperback), because it'll help expand your horizons and introduce you to some new authors. My one big nitpicky thing was that I think the intro and forward from Niigaanwewidam James Sinclair and Grace Dillon should have come before Hope Nicholson's intro; I know she edited it and it's her company, but if you're going to claim to want to put Indigenous voices at the forefront, you should not be the first one to speak. </span>
  <a data-text-id="12298857042763092642" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_2181283869" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2181283869" />
    <a title="Vanellope" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6512734-vanellope"><img alt="Vanellope" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1423692000p2/6512734.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2181283869?book_show_action=true">Oct 08, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Vanellope" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Vanellope" href="/user/show/6512734-vanellope">Vanellope</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=2018">2018</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=aliens">aliens</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=e-books">e-books</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=free-book">free-book</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=kindle">kindle</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=lgbt-plus">lgbt-plus</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=magic">magic</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=magical-realism">magical-realism</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=pub-this-century">pub-this-century</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6512734-vanellope?shelf=robots">robots</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2181283869" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer1142315889793270962">This is why I hate rating anthologies. This one was cool, but also fluctuated a lot. There were a couple where I legitimately did not know what was going on or what the point was, there were some that were cute, but not super memorable beyond that, and some that were BEAUTIFUL AND I LOVED THEM. <br /><br />My absolute favorites were <i>Perfectly You</i> by David A. Robertson (super cute story about two girls in love and making the most out of life) and <i>The Boys Who Became The Hummingbirds</i> by Daniel Heath Justice (</span>
  <span id="freeText1142315889793270962" style="display:none">This is why I hate rating anthologies. This one was cool, but also fluctuated a lot. There were a couple where I legitimately did not know what was going on or what the point was, there were some that were cute, but not super memorable beyond that, and some that were BEAUTIFUL AND I LOVED THEM. <br /><br />My absolute favorites were <i>Perfectly You</i> by David A. Robertson (super cute story about two girls in love and making the most out of life) and <i>The Boys Who Became The Hummingbirds</i> by Daniel Heath Justice (SO beautifully written, a story about being yourself and stuff I swear it made me cry). <br /><br />I also appreciated the two-spirit representation 'cause you don't see that a whole lot. <br /><br />Overall, though, it's a pretty solid anthology (and free with Kindle Unlimited!). </span>
  <a data-text-id="1142315889793270962" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_1768537101" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1768537101" />
    <a title="Cora Snow" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/47850547-cora-snow"><img alt="Cora Snow" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1536784559p2/47850547.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1768537101?book_show_action=true">May 23, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Cora Snow" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Cora Snow" href="/user/show/47850547-cora-snow">Cora Snow</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/47850547-cora-snow?shelf=anthologies">anthologies</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1768537101" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer11300756782988821322">4/5.<br /><br />Positive: This was a really great anthology full of great stories. My favourite was Né Łe!, it was so good and fun and also thoughtful, with great worldbuilding and characters. I liked the majority of the stories in this book, and as promised, they're all Indigenous authors with Indigenous characters and culture. The whole thing is really worth your time, especially if you want to diversify your TBR.<br /><br />Negative: There were two stories I didn't like, but that's ok. I think its just me.</span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1986638020" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1986638020" />
    <a title="Ashley Story" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/49521291-ashley-story"><img alt="Ashley Story" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1514821816p2/49521291.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1986638020?book_show_action=true">Apr 30, 2017</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Ashley Story" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Ashley Story" href="/user/show/49521291-ashley-story">Ashley Story</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780993997075" href="/book/show/31560094-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1986638020" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer7130772896641515997">These stories left me wanting so much more. Not because they weren't enough, but because they were so much. And I wanted more. <br /><br />"Perfectly You" made me cry. "The Boys Who Became Hummingbirds" was beautiful. "Ne-Le" was probably my favorite. Space romances do that to me, what can I say? So queer. So lovely. So brilliant. <br /><br />Cannot recommend this anthology enough. </span>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_2035966736" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2035966736" />
    <a title="Ignacia" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15374564-ignacia"><img alt="Ignacia" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_50x66-632230dc9882b4352d753eedf9396530.png" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">

      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>






    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2035966736" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer16596180550106245205">Really beautiful book! <br />I really connected with most of the stories, although not so much with a couple (I think this came down to personal aesthetic/taste), but overall a great anthology! I borrowed a copy from the library, but just went out and bought a copy of my own, today, so that I may revisit it anytime I want.<br />Highly recommended!<br /></span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_2035966736'><a id="like_count_review_2035966736" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/2035966736?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">1 like</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F31687523-love-beyond-body-space-and-time">Like</a></span>
